intro: Dimeria fuscescens var. zeylanica, commonly known as the Zeylanica dimeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which are typically green and sometimes tinged with red or purple. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, often accompanied by a distinctive, glandular, sticky substance. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
